p: Hyptolide ( 149) was the first α-pyrone isolated from Hyptidinae ( Fig. 4 ). The compound was obtained from Mesosphaerum pectinatum (syn. Hyptis pectinata) in 1920 ( Gorter, 1920), but its structure was completely elucidated only in 1964 ( Birch and Butler, 1964). Further studies were developed with this species, allowing the isolation of pectinolides A – C ( 150– 152) ( Pereda-Miranda et al., 1993) and D – H ( 153– 157) ( Boalino et al., 2003; Fragoso-Serrano et al., 2005). Recently, five α-pyrones were isolated from the same species and named as pectinolides I – M ( 158– 162) ( Martínez-Fructuoso et al., 2019).
